item.title: Over the counter, under the radar: can paracetamol become fatal? - The Hindu
item.description:
Over the Counter, Under the Radar: The Hidden Dangers of Paracetamol Poisoning

Published: January 03, 2025 05:00 am IST

Source: The Hindu

The recent death of a woman from paracetamol poisoning in Liverpool has highlighted a serious issue that claims thousands of lives annually, often unnoticed due to the drug's reputation as safe.

  • Paracetamol poisoning leads to over 60,000 emergency visits and 500 deaths per year in the USA alone.
  • It is widely perceived as a safe drug but can be fatal in excessive doses.
  • Accidental poisonings are frequent among children and intentional overdoses often occur in women.
  • In India, self-medication and easy availability of paracetamol worsen the problem.
  • The antidote is N-acetylcysteine (NAC), which is effective if administered early.
“Awareness about the risks of overdose can significantly reduce these preventable deaths.”

This article underscores the need for better regulation and public awareness to combat the rising incidence of paracetamol poisoning, often overlooked despite its serious implications.

item.title: South Korean investigators head to Seoul in attempt to detain impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol - The Times of India

“We will pursue all available avenues to hold officials accountable.”

The ongoing investigation reflects the evolving landscape of South Korean politics, where accountability is increasingly demanded by the public.

item.title: Scamster Ketan Parekh back in Sebi net, banned from market - The Times of India
item.description:
Scamster Ketan Parekh back in Sebi net, banned from market

Publication date: [Insert publication date here] | Source: [Insert source here]

Ketan Parekh, a notorious figure in the Indian stock market, has once again come under the scrutiny of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi), resulting in a ban from participating in the market.

  • Parekh's previous market manipulation led to significant market downturns.
  • This latest action reaffirms Sebi's commitment to maintaining market integrity.
  • Investors are advised to proceed with caution and stay informed about market regulations.
"This action is a clear signal to all market participants that manipulation will not be tolerated." - Sebi Official

In conclusion, Sebi's proactive measures against Ketan Parekh highlight the regulator's ongoing efforts to safeguard investors and uphold the integrity of the financial markets.

item.title: Xiaomi Poco X7 Pro Iron Man Edition teased as latest Marvel-themed Android smartphone - Notebookcheck.net
item.description:
Xiaomi Poco X7 Pro Iron Man Edition Teased as Latest Marvel-Themed Smartphone

Date: January 2, 2025   Source: Notebookcheck

Xiaomi has teased the release of a new Marvel-themed smartphone, the Poco X7 Pro Iron Man Edition, which will stand out with a unique design and is set to be unveiled globally on January 9.

  • The Poco X7 Pro Iron Man Edition is part of Xiaomi's collaboration with Marvel.
  • Features cosmetic changes, including red accents around the camera lenses and power button.
  • Expected specifications include a Dimensity 8400 Ultra chipset, a 120 Hz AMOLED display, and a large battery.
  • Likely to have limited availability, similar to the previous Deadpool Edition of the Poco F6.
“The Poco X7 Pro Iron Man Edition will primarily stand out from the standard Poco X7 Pro with an eye-catching design.”

The Poco X7 Pro Iron Man Edition is an exciting addition for fans of both Xiaomi and Marvel, showcasing collaboration in smartphone designs.

Matthew Livelsberger shot himself in head before car blew up: New details in Las Vegas Cybertruck explosion

  • Witnesses reported hearing a loud bang before the vehicle burst into flames.

"The sound was deafening, and then we saw flames shooting into the air," stated a witness.

The situation poses many unanswered questions about Livelsberger's state of mind leading up to the incident and the safety of electric vehicles in such circumstances.

item.title: Human Body Can Produce ‘Elixir’ That Slows Ageing, Research Reveals - Greek Reporter
item.description:
Human Body Can Produce 'Elixir' That Slows Ageing, Research Reveals

Publication Date: December 22, 2024 | Source: GreekReporter.com

Researchers have identified a natural elixir produced by the liver, known as lithocholic acid (LCA), that has shown the potential to improve muscle recovery, strengthen grip, and boost endurance by mimicking the anti-ageing effects associated with calorie restriction.

  • LCA activates AMP-activated protein kinase (AMPK), regulating energy use in the body.
  • The compound has been shown to extend lifespans in fruit flies and a microscopic worm species.
  • In experiments, LCA extended the average lifespan of worms from 22 to 27 days and increased lifespan in fruit flies.
  • Researchers aim to explore potential human applications and develop LCA into a pill for various ages and health conditions.
“People have long sought an elixir for longevity. LCA is one possibility... activates AMPK, which in turn further induces metabolite changes in the blood.” - Lin Shengcai, metabolic biologist

Despite promising results, further research is needed to confirm LCA’s effects in humans. The findings represent a significant breakthrough in ageing research and could lead to therapies that not only extend lifespans but also improve the quality of life in later years.

item.title: 5 years after COVID, new epidemic in China which affecting children and elderly - The Times of India
item.description:
5 years after COVID, new epidemic in China which affecting children and elderly

Date: October 2023

Source: The Times of India

This article discusses the rise of respiratory illnesses in China, including influenza A and hMPV, primarily affecting children and the elderly. This increase is related to colder weather and the return to normal life post-COVID.

  • Respiratory illnesses are notably affecting children and the elderly due to seasonal changes and increased social interactions.
  • No formal alerts or declarations of emergencies have been issued by health authorities.
  • Rumors of overwhelmed hospitals are unsubstantiated and lack credible evidence.
  • The increase in cases is mostly seasonal and not indicative of a new pandemic.
  • Good hygiene practices and staying home when sick are recommended to prevent the spread.
Respiratory illnesses, including hMPV, are rising, particularly affecting children and the elderly, due to post-COVID factors and colder weather.

In conclusion, while there is a rise in respiratory illnesses, it remains a seasonal spike, and individuals are encouraged to maintain hygiene and health practices to mitigate risks.

item.title: Quadrantid Meteor Shower: First 'shooting stars' of 2025 – when and where to watch - India Today
item.description:
Quadrantid Meteor Shower: First 'shooting stars' of 2025 – when and where to watch

Published On: Jan 3, 2025

Source: indiastodayglobal

The Quadrantid meteor shower will peak on January 3, 2025, offering the first major celestial event of the year with a potential display of up to 200 meteors per hour in optimal conditions.

  • The meteor shower is active from December 26, 2024, to January 16, 2025.
  • Best viewing time is in the early morning hours before dawn on January 3.
  • Ideal viewing conditions include dark, clear skies away from city lights, particularly in the Northern Hemisphere.
  • NASA emphasizes the importance of allowing your eyes to adjust to darkness for the best experience.
“The sight of these large, colourful explosions of light will be a stunning way to start your year.”

Don't miss the chance to observe this beautiful astronomical event, ensuring you have the best conditions to enjoy the stunning display of meteors.

item.title: Pushpa 2 Hindi Box Office Day 28 (Early Trends): Allu Arjun Only 3.75 Crore Away From The Biggest Milestone Of Hindi Cinema! - Koimoi
item.description:
Pushpa 2 Hindi Box Office Day 28 (Early Trends): Allu Arjun Only 3.75 Crore Away From The Biggest Milestone

Date: January 2, 2025 | Source: Koimoi

Pushpa 2 Hindi has witnessed another strong day at the box office, reaching an estimated total of 796.25 crore in 28 days. The film is only 3.75 crore away from hitting the 800 crore mark, a significant milestone in Hindi Cinema.

  • On Day 28, the film earned between 3.5 to 4 crore.
  • Despite a drop from the New Year’s collection of 10 crore, it stays on track for more records.
  • Week-wise earnings show a robust performance, with a total of 796.25 crore estimated.
  • The film is witnessing the biggest fourth-week box office collection at an estimated 56 crore, 48% higher than the previous record.
“The fourth week of Pushpa 2 has finally ended at an estimated 56 crore at the box office.”

Overall, Pushpa 2 continues to perform exceptionally well, maintaining strong attendance rates and inching ever closer to record-breaking achievements in Hindi cinema.

item.title: HMPV: The mysterious virus gripping China — What You Need to Know - CNBCTV18
item.description:
HMPV: The Mysterious Virus Gripping China

Publication Date: March 2024

Source: CNBC TV18

China is currently facing an outbreak of the human metapneumovirus (HMPV), which causes flu-like symptoms and primarily affects vulnerable populations such as children and the elderly.

  • The HMPV outbreak is raising concerns in several regions of China, five years after COVID-19 surfaced.
  • The virus is an RNA virus first identified in 2001 and has been observed globally as a respiratory pathogen.
  • Transmission occurs through droplets and close contact, with symptoms resembling the common cold.
  • The virus can lead to severe respiratory issues like bronchitis and pneumonia, particularly in at-risk individuals.
  • China's CDC has issued recommendations including mask-wearing and good hygiene practices.
  • Laboratory protocols for case reporting and verification are being established to monitor the situation.
  • Recent data shows a rise in respiratory infections linked to HMPV, especially among children under 14 in northern provinces.
“Data from Dec 16-22 indicates a rise in acute respiratory infections, including HMPV, particularly in northern provinces.”

The situation with HMPV underscores the importance of readiness and response to respiratory outbreaks, with lessons learned from the COVID-19 pandemic informing current measures.

item.title: Musk is standing in the way as Bezos reaches for orbit - Financial Times
item.description:
Musk is Standing in the Way as Bezos Reaches for Orbit

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Financial Times

This article discusses Jeff Bezos’s Blue Origin as it attempts to launch a rocket into orbit, a pivotal moment in the private space race against Elon Musk’s SpaceX, which has seen considerable success.

  • Blue Origin has faced delays and is attempting to launch its orbital rocket, New Glenn.
  • The private space race sees competition intensifying between Bezos and Musk.
  • Musk’s political influence and the growing costs in space exploration pose challenges for Bezos.
  • Expectation that the demand for launches will exceed supply through the rest of the decade.
  • Governments face a new challenge in controlling a space business that is dominated by wealthy individuals.
“The demand for space launches is expected to far exceed supply for the rest of this decade.”

This event marks a significant turning point in private space exploration, with implications for both business and politics as rival billionaires push the boundaries of space travel.

item.title: Dinesh Vijan reveals release dates of 'Bhediya 2', 'Stree 3', and 'Munjya 2' from the horror comedy unive - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Dinesh Vijan reveals release dates of 'Bhediya 2', 'Stree 3', and 'Munjya 2'

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

The horror comedy universe expands with new sequels and spin-offs, generating excitement among fans.

  • Upcoming films from 2025 to 2028 include 'Thama', 'Shakti Shalini', 'Bhediya 2', 'Stree 3', and 'Munjya 2'.
  • 'Thama' will kick off the series in 2025, with notable stars Ayushmann Khurrana and Rashmika Mandanna.
  • 'Bhediya 2' is set for an August 14, 2026 release, followed by 'Chamunda' on December 4, 2026.
  • 'Stree 3', starring Shraddha Kapoor, is scheduled for August 13, 2027.
  • The series will conclude with two films on August 11 and October 18, 2028.
“Ab aaya hamara MARVEL-lous schedule!” - Fan Comment

This lineup is being likened to Marvel's cinematic offerings, with fans eager for the upcoming releases.

item.title: Jennifer Lopez relates to her Unstoppable character's ‘challenging relationships’ amid divorce from Ben Affleck - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Jennifer Lopez relates to her Unstoppable character Judy Robles, sharing similarities in their challenging relationships amid split with Ben Affleck.

Date: Jan 02, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a new interview, Jennifer Lopez revealed that she strongly found her character from Unstoppable, Judy Robles’s “challenging relationships” relatable. She mentioned a connection with her character amidst her divorce from Ben Affleck.

  • Lopez described shared experiences with Judy Robles, emphasizing their Latina backgrounds and motherhood.
  • Amid her divorce, she appreciates the strength that relationships require.
  • Despite the split, Lopez and Affleck maintain a cooperative relationship for their families.
“We both grew up Latina in this country. We both had children and had hopes and dreams for them. We both had challenging relationships.”

Lopez continues to navigate her personal challenges while finding solace in her character's strength, illustrating the complexities of love and motherhood.

item.title: Karnataka: Woman kills husband, smashes his face with stone, chops body - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Woman Arrested for Murdering Husband, Disposing Body in Karnataka

Date: Jan 02, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

A woman in Karnataka's Belagavi was arrested for allegedly murdering her husband and chopping his body, police said on Thursday.

  • The woman allegedly strangled her 40-year-old husband, identified as Srimantha Itnali, and then smashed his face with a stone.
  • She cut his body into two pieces to dispose of it away from her house.
  • The incident took place on December 8, and the body was found on December 10 in Umarani village in Chikkodi taluk of Belagavi.
  • The police initially did not suspect the woman, but later brought her in for questioning, and she confessed to the crime.
  • The husband was reportedly a drunkard who abused his wife for money and wanted her to sell a piece of land to buy him a new motorbike.
"She first strangled him and when he was unconscious, used a boulder lying nearby to smash his face. She then disposed of the boulder in a well."

The woman has been taken into custody.

item.title: Raza, Nyamhuri share spoils as Afghanistan all out for 157 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Raza, Nyamhuri share spoils as Afghanistan all out for 157

Date: Jan 02, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Veteran Sikandar Raza and teenager Newman Nyamhuri took three wickets each as Zimbabwe bowled out Afghanistan for 157 on Thursday on the first day of the second Test in Bulawayo.

  • Zimbabwe started their innings with 6 runs at stumps.
  • Captain Craig Ervine won the toss and chose to bowl, capitalizing on favorable conditions.
  • Afghanistan's captain Hashmatullah Shahidi and Rahmat Shah had notable performances in the past, but couldn't replicate their success this time.
  • A 27-run last-wicket stand helped Afghanistan reach a total of 157.
“Given the conditions, I was convinced bowling first was the way to go. The wicket had been under covers for some time.” - Craig Ervine

This match showcases the promising talent of Zimbabwe's young players and highlights the challenges faced by the Afghan team in this Test series.

item.title: Manu Bhaker, D Gukesh Among Four Champion Athletes Selected For Khel Ratna Award - News18
item.description:
Manu Bhaker, D Gukesh Among Four Champion Athletes Selected For Khel Ratna Award

Published on: January 02, 2025, 21:01 IST | Source: News18

The Ministry of Youth Affairs & Sports has announced the National Sports Awards 2024, honoring Manu Bhaker, D Gukesh, Harmanpreet Singh, and Praveen Kumar with the Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award.

  • Ministry announced the awards on January 02, 2025.
  • Manu Bhaker is the first athlete from independent India to win two medals in a single Olympics.
  • D Gukesh became the youngest World champion and helped the Indian team win gold at the Chess Olympiad.
  • Harmanpreet Singh led the Indian hockey team to a bronze medal and Praveen Kumar was crowned T64 champion in para athletics.
  • The awards ceremony will be held on January 17, 2025, at Rashtrapati Bhavan.
"The awardees will receive their awards from the President of India."

The recognition of these athletes highlights their contributions and achievements in Indian sports, inspiring future generations.

item.title: 10 after-dinner rituals that can help in digestion, prevent bloating - The Times of India
item.description:
10 After-Dinner Rituals to Enhance Digestion and Prevent Bloating

Publication Date: Jan 2, 2025 | Source: Times of India

Implementing certain after-dinner rituals can significantly improve digestion and prevent bloating, ensuring a healthier gut.

  • Consume probiotics like yogurt or kefir.
  • Chew fennel seeds for their natural digestive qualities.
  • Take a light 10-15 minute walk after dinner for better digestion.
  • Drink warm water or herbal teas such as ginger or peppermint.
  • Stay hydrated throughout the day, but avoid large quantities of water immediately post-meal.
  • Engage in gentle stretches like yoga to relieve tension.
  • Avoid lying down for at least 2-3 hours after eating.
  • Massage your abdomen to stimulate digestion.
  • Choose light desserts with fruit or dark chocolate to satisfy cravings without overloading the digestive system.
“Every little effort put in can be rewarded with a healthy gut and overall fitness.”

Carefully incorporating these rituals into daily life can lead to improved digestive health and overall well-being.
